plugins.name: 앱스토어 리뷰 추출기 (Appstpre Review Extractor)
plugins.description:
🧩 애플 앱스토어 리뷰를 Figma 프레임에 손쉽게 가져와 정리하세요

Easily import and organize Apple App Store reviews into your Figma frames


이 플러그인은 Apple App Store의 앱 리뷰를 가져와 평점별로 정리해줍니다.

사용자 피드백 분석, 제품 개선 준비, 인사이트 시각화 등 다양한 상황에서

실사용자 의견을 Figma 안에서 빠르고 효율적으로 표현할 수 있습니다.

→ This plugin fetches app reviews from the Apple App Store and organizes them by rating.

It's perfect for analyzing user feedback, planning improvements, and visualizing insights—all within Figma.


🔍 주요 기능 | Key Features

최근 평점별(5★, 4★ 등) 리뷰 가져오기 가능

→ Import recent reviews by rating (e.g., 5★, 4★)


현재 운영 중인 앱의 현황 확인, 고객의 pain point 확인

→ Check the current status of your app and identify user pain points


UX 리서치, 앱 디자인, 제품 문서화에 활용 가능

→ Use in UX research, app design, and product documentation


🛠 사용순서 | How to Use

1) 플러그인을 실행하세요

→ Launch the plugin


2) 사용하고자 하는 앱스토어 ID를 확인합니다

→ Find the App Store ID of your target app

(https://www.apple.com/kr/app-store/에서 앱 검색 후 주소창에 id숫자 확인/복사)

→ (Search the app on the App Store and copy the numeric id from the URL)


3) 해당 ID를 플러그인 입력창에 붙여넣습니다

→ Paste the ID into the plugin input field


4) 원하는 평점(예: 5★) 을 선택합니다

→ Select the desired rating (e.g., 5★)


5) "리뷰 불러오기" 버튼을 클릭합니다

→ Click the "Import Reviews" button

accepted.name: kenny
accepted.description: I am a designer who creates the tools and experiences that users truly need. I believe good design goes beyond visuals, flow and development.

plugins.tagline: App Store 리뷰를 한눈에, 피그마로 정리하자 (in Figma, Check your app review)

plugins.name: Section Logger
plugins.description: ¡No pierdas ni un cambio! Con Section Logger, cada modificación en tus secciones de Figma queda registrada automáticamente. Visualiza los cambios en tiempo real, guarda un historial detallado de tus ediciones y personaliza el diseño con colores que se ajustan a tu estilo. Ideal para equipos que buscan organización, colaboración y eficiencia. ¡Mejora tu flujo de trabajo ahora!
plugins.tagline: Transforma tu flujo de trabajo: registra, organiza y visualiza cambios de diseño veloz.

129666.name: Section Logger
129666.description: ¡No pierdas ni un cambio! Con Section Logger, cada modificación en tus secciones de Figma queda registrada automáticamente. Visualiza los cambios en tiempo real, guarda un historial detallado de tus ediciones y personaliza el diseño con colores que se ajustan a tu estilo. Ideal para equipos que buscan organización, colaboración y eficiencia. ¡Mejora tu flujo de trabajo ahora!
129666.release_notes:
Release Note: Versión 1.1

Nuevas funcionalidades:
1.Soporte de idioma (Español/Inglés):
•Se ha implementado un selector de idioma en la UI del plugin, que permite cambiar entre español e inglés con un switch/slider intuitivo.
•El idioma de la interfaz (títulos, botones y textos) cambia dinámicamente según la selección del usuario.
•El texto de los logs registrados también cambia de idioma, mostrando la información correctamente tanto en español como en inglés, dependiendo del idioma seleccionado.
2.Actualización de sticker:
•Mejora de la gestión de stickers: Ahora, si un sticker ya existe, se actualiza con los nuevos logs en lugar de crear uno nuevo cada vez que se registra una edición.
•Si el sticker ya está presente, su contenido se limpia y se reemplaza con los nuevos logs, garantizando que no haya stickers duplicados.

Mejoras adicionales:
•Se mejoró el posicionamiento dinámico del sticker, asegurando que se mantenga correctamente ubicado en la esquina superior izquierda de la sección.
•Se optimizó el código para hacer el plugin más eficiente y evitar la creación de stickers innecesarios.

Fixes:
•Se solucionó un problema en el que un nuevo sticker se creaba cada vez que se registraba un log, incluso si ya existía uno previamente.
129666.tagline: Transforma tu flujo de trabajo: registra, organiza y visualiza cambios de diseño veloz.

plugins.name: SP Grid Table Generator
plugins.description: Quickly generate editable AG Grid-style tables in Figma. Customize column headers and input row data before generating a clean, structured table—complete with filter icons, dividers, and consistent styling. Perfect for dashboards, admin panels, and data-heavy UI mockups.

plugins.name: TOC Please - Auto TOC Generator
plugins.description:
A plugin that helps you easily explore and manage complex Figma pages by generating a Table of Contents (TOC).


Features

1. In-plugin TOC generation

  1. Automatically collects frames with a specified prefix to generate a TOC
  2. Currently sorts frames based on their X-axis position on the Figma canvas (support for layer order coming soon)
  3. Click items to instantly navigate to the corresponding frame
  4. Supports up to 2 levels of nested items


2. Canvas TOC generation

  1. Create a TOC frame directly on the Figma canvas
  2. The TOC frame is fully customizable to suit your needs.
  3. When TOC content changes, simply select the TOC frame and click “Update” to refresh the content while preserving your custom styles.
plugins.tagline: Auto-generate a TOC from frames with a specific prefix. Click items to quickly navigate.

128139.name: TOC Please - Auto TOC Generator
128139.description:
A plugin that helps you easily explore and manage complex Figma pages by generating a Table of Contents (TOC).


Features

  1. Automatically collects frames with a specified prefix to generate a TOC
  2. Currently sorts frames based on their X-axis position on the Figma canvas (support for layer order coming soon)
  3. Click items to instantly navigate to the corresponding frame
  4. Supports up to 2 levels of nested items


2. Canvas TOC generation

  1. Create a TOC frame directly on the Figma canvas
  2. The TOC frame is fully customizable to suit your needs.
  3. When TOC content changes, simply select the TOC frame and click “Update” to refresh the content while preserving your custom styles.
128139.release_notes: Optimized speed of extracting frames for TOC
128139.tagline: Auto-generate a TOC from frames with a specific prefix. Click items to quickly navigate.

plugins.name: Calculadora de Percentual

Compare facilmente valores como cliques ou CTRs e visualize instantaneamente a variação percentual entre um valor atual e seu valor de referência.

Ideal para designers, analistas e times de marketing que lidam com dashboards, KPIs e apresentações de performance.


✔️ Interface simples e intuitiva

✔️ Resultado com destaque em verde (positivo) ou vermelho (negativo)

✔️ Cálculo automático

plugins.name: ColourSwatch
plugins.description:
Enhance your Figma workflow with the ColourSwatch plugin


Streamline the creation, management, and updating of colour swatches using local or published Figma colour variables. This plugin provides a clear visual overview of all the colours in your project, ensuring consistency and efficiency.


With this plugin, you can easily create a ColourSwatch component. For each colour variable —whether from a local collection or a linked, published Figma library — you can generate a component instance. Use the plugin to effortlessly update values such as hex codes, alpha values, and colour variable names — one by one or as a batch for all colour swatches on the same page.
plugins.tagline: Create maintain and update colour swatches based on your Figma colour variables.

127153.name: ColourSwatch
127153.description:
Enhance your Figma workflow with the ColourSwatch plugin


Streamline the creation, management, and updating of colour swatches using local or published Figma colour variables. This plugin provides a clear visual overview of all the colours in your project, ensuring consistency and efficiency.


With this plugin, you can easily create a ColourSwatch component. For each colour variable —whether from a local collection or a linked, published Figma library — you can generate a component instance. Use the plugin to effortlessly update values such as hex codes, alpha values, and colour variable names — one by one or as a batch for all colour swatches on the same page.

networkAccess.reasoning: No network access needed for the plugin.

127153.tagline: Create maintain and update colour swatches based on your Figma colour variables.

plugins.name: Renamer
plugins.description:
Renamer — Smarter Layer Naming


A Figma plugin that keeps your layers organized by automatically generating clear, descriptive names based on their properties. Perfect for maintaining a consistent and readable file structure in complex designs.


Just select your layers and run the plugin — names will be updated instantly based on your settings.


Layer properties included:

  1. Dimensions (width × height)
  2. Fill color (HEX code)
  3. Opacity values
  4. Effects (shadows, blurs)
  5. Constraints
  6. Corner radius
  7. Stroke details
  8. Auto Layout settings

accepted.name: Pavel Grachev
accepted.description: Product designer. Focused on clarity, usability, and quality design systems.

plugins.tagline: Automatically rename layers based on design properties

plugins.name: QD - Revix - AI Feedback
plugins.description:
Get AI-Powered UI/UX Feedback Instantly! 🚀


Struggling to spot design issues? Let AI do the work! This powerful plugin analyzes your designs, provides insightful UI/UX feedback, and instantly adds comments, helping you refine your work faster and smarter.


✨ How it works:

✅ Select a design frame and start the analysis.

✅ Get multiple AI-generated feedback suggestions.

✅ Instantly add feedback as comments on your design.


Save time, improve usability, and design with confidence. all with the power of AI! 🦾🤖
plugins.tagline: AI feedback and comments on designs

plugins.name: Gename Thai
plugins.description:
Generate Random Thai Names Plugin


Quickly generate random Thai names for your designs! This plugin allows you to select one or multiple text fields and generate random names for males or females, with the option to include or exclude surnames.


❖ Generate Unique Names: Ensure each selected text field gets a distinct, random name.

❖ Customizable Gender Selection: Choose from male or female names based on your project needs.

❖ Surname Option: Add Thai surnames for a complete name experience.

❖ Easy Integration: Select your text fields, click "Generate", and watch your text change instantly!


---


สร้างชื่อไทยแบบสุ่มได้อย่างรวดเร็วสำหรับการออกแบบของคุณ! ปลั๊กอินนี้ช่วยให้คุณเลือกข้อความหนึ่งหรือหลายช่อง เพื่อสร้างชื่อสุ่มสำหรับผู้ชายหรือผู้หญิง โดยเลือกได้ว่าจะมีนามสกุลหรือไม่มี


❖ สร้างชื่อที่ไม่ซ้ำกัน: ให้ชื่อที่สุ่มออกมาไม่ซ้ำกันในแต่ละช่องข้อความที่เลือก

❖ เลือกเพศได้ตามต้องการ: สามารถเลือกชื่อสำหรับผู้ชายหรือผู้หญิงได้ตามความต้องการ

❖ ตัวเลือกนามสกุล: สามารถเพิ่มนามสกุลไทยให้กับชื่อได้

❖ การใช้งานง่าย: เลือกช่องข้อความ กด "Generate" แล้วชื่อจะถูกเปลี่ยนทันที
plugins.tagline: Generate Thai name

plugins.name: DevPlugin - Copy Disign
plugins.description:
DevPlugin is a plugin for fast migration of components.


DevPlugin automates the process of obtaining and implementing components into web projects. The plugin creates secure scripts based on the layout and allows you to use them on any external resources.


What he can do:

  1. Generating a custom JS script
  2. Personal account with subscription management and action history
  3. Data encryption and protection of user tokens


Fits:

  1. UI/UX designer
  2. Developers of landing pages and interfaces
  3. To the authors of design systems
plugins.tagline: We will help you transfer your design to the constructor with all the adaptive designs.

plugins.name: List Replace

Check out my bento for all my socials!

plugins.name: Remove and select next
plugins.description:
😟 FIGMA NATIVE BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer triggers a global deselect.

Consequently, you need to take your mouse to select the next layer you want to work on.


🥳 PLUGIN BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer select the next layer.

Meaning you don't need to take your mouse back and you can continue to design at the speed of light on your keyboard!


⌨️ KEYBOARD SHORTCUT

Plugins can't have keyboard shortcuts so you'll have to set it on your own.

See this page for a tutorial on macOS native keyboard shortcuts and BetterTouchTools
plugins.tagline: Remove layers without leaving your keyboard

113969.tagline: Remove layers without leaving your keyboard

plugins.name: Generic Tailwind Generator
plugins.description:
Lasy to write font-size, font-weight, background-color, border-radius and all other generic props in every project ? Me too.

plugins.name: K Translation
plugins.description:
K Translation is a localization tool designed to simplify the process of translating your Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files.


After installing the plugin, the user uploads an XLIFF file containing translations. The plugin analyzes the file, determines the source language, and lists available target languages.


The user then selects which languages to translate the frame into. To begin the translation, simply select a frame in Figma that contains text elements.


Once the "Create copy" button is pressed, the plugin automatically scans all the text within the frame and creates copies of the frame for each selected target language, effectively localizing your design with just a few click.
plugins.tagline: K Translation: localize Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files in just a few clicks.

103740.name: K Translation
103740.description:
K Translation is a localization tool designed to simplify the process of translating your Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files.


After installing the plugin, the user uploads an XLIFF file containing translations. The plugin analyzes the file, determines the source language, and lists available target languages.


The user then selects which languages to translate the frame into. To begin the translation, simply select a frame in Figma that contains text elements.


Once the "Create copy" button is pressed, the plugin automatically scans all the text within the frame and creates copies of the frame for each selected target language, effectively localizing your design with just a few click.
103740.release_notes: Added the ability to download a file containing texts that were not translated.
103740.tagline: K Translation: localize Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files in just a few clicks.

plugins.name: comodo exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you rename and export layers named $IMG in your Figma project based on special tags. You can choose between two workflows:

  1. Destructive export: Layers are renamed and export settings applied (JPG, PNG, SVG, @1x, @2x, @3x). Once renamed, the original $IMG layers are lost, and the plugin cannot be rerun unless you revert to an earlier version.
  2. Non-destructive export: The plugin creates a new page where it duplicates and renames all matching layers, preserving the original ones. You can delete the new page and restart anytime.

A Figma template will soon be provided with pre-set tags and an organized layout to make your workflow faster and more reliable. More detailed documentation will also follow.
plugins.tagline: Rename & export $IMG layers via tags. Template & docs coming soon for easy setup.

134292.description:

  2. Non-destructive export: The plugin creates a new page where it duplicates and renames all matching layers, preserving the original ones. You can delete the new page and restart anytime.

A Figma template will soon be provided with pre-set tags and an organized layout to make your workflow faster and more reliable. More detailed documentation will also follow.
134292.tagline: Rename & export $IMG layers via tags. Template & docs coming soon for easy setup.

plugins.name: Find All My Fonts
plugins.description:
Find My Fonts provides a detailed and structured report of all fonts used in your Figma design.

  1. Get a complete overview of all fonts used in your file
  2. Detect unaccounted or hidden fonts across pages and frames
  3. Find repeated text names that may indicate duplicates
  4. Identify fonts inside hidden layers, components, and instances
  5. Choose between analyzing the current page, all pages, or selected frames
  6. Filter by text-only layers, hidden content, or component structure
  7. Group results by font family, font size, or duplicate names
  8. Select matching layers directly from the report
  9. Export the full font usage report to PDF for further review or documentation

The plugin supports 9 languages and has a clean interface with light and dark theme.
plugins.tagline: fonts, report, text layers, hidden text, duplicates, components, pdf export, fontfamily, fontstyle

138988.name: Find All My Fonts
138988.description:

  4. Identify fonts inside hidden layers, components, and instances
  5. Choose between analyzing the current page, all pages, or selected frames
  6. Filter by text-only layers, hidden content, or component structure
  7. Group results by font family, font size, or duplicate names
  8. Select matching layers directly from the report
  9. Export the full font usage report to PDF for further review or documentation

The plugin supports 9 languages and has a clean interface with light and dark theme.
138988.tagline: fonts, report, text layers, hidden text, duplicates, components, pdf export, fontfamily, fontstyle

plugins.name: Image Converter
plugins.description:
💖 Why you'll love Image Converter

This plugin allows you to convert your design images into one of the following formats:

  1. Convert image to SVG,
  2. Convert image to PNG,
  3. Convert image to JPEG, or
  4. Convert image to a link format for a smoother workflow.


💬 Any feedbacks and questions are welcome at designer.oladipupo@gmail.com


↘️ Step-by-step Guide

1. Add an image to Figma.

2. Select the image layer.

3. Click the "Load Selected Image" button.

4. Choose your desired format.

5. Convert and download your file.
plugins.tagline: Convert your images to any formats in just a few clicks

plugins.name: Jo - Instant Design Feedback
plugins.description:
Stop designing in the dark.

Jo gives you instant validation without leaving Figma.


Two ways to get unstuck:

🔍 Heuristic Check — Usability feedback against Nielsen's 10 principles

Select a frame → get ranked issues with specific fixes


📊 Quick Poll — Stakeholder sign-off in minutes

Select 2-4 frames → Generate link → teammates vote/comment (no Figma login required)


Why designers are loving Jo:

✅ In-Context Feedback: Feedback panel sits right next to your canvas.

🎯 Actionable Insights: Specific fixes, not vague opinions.

⏱️ Zero Meeting Overhead: Async feedback that actually works.

🔁 Iteration-Friendly: Tweak, test, and ship with confidence.


Perfect for:

Validating concepts, streamlining stakeholder buy-in, catching usability issues before dev handoff.


Ready to design with confidence?

Install Jo today and transform your feedback loops!
plugins.tagline: Get AI and teammate feedback on your designs. No meetings, no guesswork.

plugins.name: Tablify
plugins.description:
Tablify is a powerful and flexible plugin that turns structured data into clean, styled tables directly in your Figma files. Whether you’re working with CSVs, Google Sheets, Excel files, or even Word documents, Tablify makes it effortless to visualize your data with consistency and control.


Features


Multiple Input Formats


  1. Upload from CSV, TSV, Excel (.xlsx/.xls), Word (.docx), PDF, HTML, XML, ODS, ODT
  2. Supports Google Sheets via public URL — just paste the link, choose a sheet, and you’re ready to go
  3. Drag & drop supported for local files


Intelligent Parsing


  1. Detects and handles multiple tables per document (e.g. Excel sheets or Word tables)
  2. Automatically cleans and parses content for structured layout
  3. Handles complex table structures, colspans, and headers


Design-Ready Tables


  1. Generates clean, structured Figma components
  2. Supports auto layout or fixed layout styles
  3. Responsive to Figma color variables, padding, radius, fonts, and more


Customization Options


  1. Auto Layout
  2. Header Row
  3. Style Variables (automatically created and bound)
  4. Automatically generates reusable tokens for colors, sizes, and text styles


Perfect for


  1. UI and product designers
  2. Dashboards, admin panels, data-heavy UIs
  3. Rapid prototyping with live spreadsheet content
  4. Importing structured data into Figma layouts with no manual copying


Why Tablify?


Unlike basic table creators, Tablify focuses on precision, flexibility, and deep Figma integration. It’s built for speed and scale — helping you go from spreadsheet to structured layout in seconds.


💬 Questions or feedback? Telegram ・ Email

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.tagline: Smart Table Generator for Figma

plugins.name: Fastr Exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin can convert a Figma file into a Fastr compatible format. This will generate a .zip file that you can import into Fastr Frontend platform. One quick import is all it takes to transform your Figma files into fully interactive experiences—brand components, fonts, and layouts intact. Get ready to edit, animate, and publish designs faster than ever before.


How to use the plug-in

If you have any issues when using the plugin, we recommend visiting our community article, which has a full guide and FAQs. For more information about the Fastr Frontend platform, please visit our website.


Reporting Issues

For any questions, please email support@getfastr.com and our team can assist further


License


This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

Copyright (c) KALEIDOS INC

The Fastr Exporter was built using the Penpot Exporter.

Penpot and the Penpot exporter plugin are Kaleidos’ open source projects.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly Bring Your Figma Designs into Fastr Frontend

plugins.name: Design to System
plugins.description:
Design to System is a Figma plugin that helps you convert your existing designs into a structured design system — effortlessly.

With just a few clicks, you can extract styles from your design, register them as local styles, and reapply them consistently across your file.


Key Features

  1. 🔍 Analyze Selection : Extracts all design style properties (colors, text styles, shadows) from the selected layers. Color values are automatically categorized into background, text, and stroke styles for easier organization.
  2. 📌 Register Styles : Registers the extracted styles into your Figma local styles panel. This enables consistent reuse and supports design system creation.
  3. 🎯 Apply Styles : Applies the registered local styles back to the selected design elements — ensuring consistency and systemization.
plugins.tagline: Turn your designs into a reusable system – automatically.

136167.name: Design to System
136167.description:
Design to System is a Figma plugin that helps you convert your existing designs into a structured design system — effortlessly.

With just a few clicks, you can extract styles from your design, register them as local styles, and reapply them consistently across your file.


Key Features

  1. 🔍 Analyze Selection : Extracts all design style properties (colors, text styles, shadows) from the selected layers. Color values are automatically categorized into background, text, and stroke styles for easier organization.
  2. 📌 Register Styles : Registers the extracted styles into your Figma local styles panel. This enables consistent reuse and supports design system creation.
  3. 🎯 Apply Styles : Applies the registered local styles back to the selected design elements — ensuring consistency and systemization.
136167.tagline: Turn your designs into a reusable system – automatically.

plugins.name: Awesome Bulk Metadata Importer
plugins.description:
Have you ever tried to add extra documentation to your Figma components, looking or better parity with your code or docs site? With this plugin, you can better utilize the Assets menu by searching components or icons by description or keywords.


This plugin checks a JSON file, and updates the alt text/description, synonym keywords, and link for all components and variants. Run this 1x for your entire library and stop wasting time manually updating metadata!


Sample CSV and JSON template
plugins.tagline: Bulk update your component descriptions, keywords, and docs link

plugins.name: Content Magic Filler with OpenAI
plugins.description:
1. Select one or more layers in your Figma file (the plugin will find all text layers within your selection).
  2. Open the plugin and enter your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/4936850-where-do-i-find-my-openai-api-key
  3. Type a prompt or instruction describing the kind of text you want (e.g., “US zip code”, “company name”, “city in Japan”).
  4. Click "Generate Text". Each selected text layer will be filled with a unique, AI-generated response matching your instruction.
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma text layers with smart, unique AI-generated content.

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin needs to communicate with OpenAI's API to generate AI-powered text content for selected layers in Figma.

140216.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma text layers with smart, unique AI-generated content.

plugins.name: JSON Frame Mapper
plugins.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.


Wouldn't it be useful to map the data to the template, press a button and - BAM! - loads of content based on the template with the data from your collection?


I think so.


---


This plugin is completely free so feel free to not buy me a [coffee](https://buymeacoffee.com/shragor)


Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider 🤔


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens


---


## The data


Currently the **JSON Frame Mapper** accepts only a JSON in this form:


```

[

{

"name": [Item 1's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

{

"name": [Item 2's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---


## Other stuff


- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- On successfully loading a JSON, it will display the number of items and fields such as ```25 items with 23 fields loaded```

- It looks for {{fieldNames}} whenever a frame is selected so you can deselect or select another frame/template after the JSON is loaded

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets → Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field
plugins.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

137181.name: JSON Frame Mapper
137181.description:

## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.

I think so.

Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider 🤔

2. Exiting Figma

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin allows users to load images and data from their local development servers. Users often run local servers on common ports (3000, 4000, 5000, 8000, 8080, 9000) to serve images, SVG files, and JSON data that they want to import into their Figma designs. Localhost access enables seamless integration with local development workflows and self-hosted content.

137181.release_notes:
Now accepts and imports SVGs.

If an object {{field}} (a rectangle or square, say) is mapped to a SVG, the object will be replaced by a frame containing a group of the SVG. The SVG will be exactly the same size, shape and location (in the design) as the parent {{field}}
137181.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data
